description: Sunscreen is the best way to protect ourselves against skin cancer. But doctors are concerned by a backlash against sunscreen that is spreading on social media. Recent surveys suggest many younger Americans are buying into this misinformation, at a time when skin cancer is rising in this age group.
title: Some TikTok influencers are maligning sunscreen. Here's what to know about the claims

description: The U.S. Supreme Court overturned a federal ban on the devices, which could have wider implications for what qualifies as a machine gun.
title: What the bump stock ban could mean for guns in the U.S.

description: Heavy rain in south Florida this week saturated the field where the U.S. cricket team had been scheduled to play a Friday match. Officials called it off, automatically sending the U.S. to the next stage.
title: The U.S. Advances in the Cricket World Cup

description: When it comes to large school districts—Chicago has seen vast improvement with reading scores for elementary school students exceeding pre-pandemic levels.
title: Readings scores rise for Chicago kids

description: Milwaukee residents are defending their city after reports Donald Trump called the city "horrible." But a Trump spokesperson say the comments were falsely characterized and he was talking about crime.
title: Milwaukee reacts to Trump comments

description: NPR's Sacha Pfeiffer talks with Eric Hoover, reporter at The Chronicle of Higher Education, about how last year’s chaotic rollout of the FAFSA is affecting colleges and universities.
title: FAFSA UPDATE AND IMPACT

description: A Gaza zoo owner is calling for help rescuing three lions left behind in Rafah, amid an Israeli offensive on Hamas in the city.
title: A Gaza zoo owner had to flee amid war... leaving some animals behind

description: A vexing phenomenon is plaguing the labor market. "Ghost jobs" refer to listings by employers that either aren't real or have already been filled but never lead to an actual hire. This is frustrating not only to job seekers but also to the Federal Reserve, which is trying to steer the economy to a stable place.
title: What are "Ghost Jobs"?

description: Uncommitted delegates are planning how to influence the Democratic National Convention in August after voters cast primary ballots to protest President Biden's handling of the war in Gaza.
title: What's next for uncommitted movement?

description: House Republicans held the attorney general in contempt for defying a subpoena, but prosecutors said he enjoys a legal shield because the president claimed executive privilege over tapes they sought.
title: Justice Department won't pursue contempt charges against Garland

description: In India, the world's largest democracy, Prime Minister Narendra Modi recently won a third term in office. While he is clearly popular, during his time in power there has also been brutal repression of dissent. We examine a major scandal that unfolded in the run-up to the previous election, five years ago, and examine what it means for the health of Indian democracy.
title: How the Planet's Biggest Democracy Deals with a Major Scandal

description: Florida recently issued new guidance on when an abortion can be performed under exceptions, but providers say it has caused even more confusion.
title: Why providers say abortion ban exceptions continue to cause confusion

description: The African National Congress and its main opposition, the Democratic Alliance, along with the smaller Inkatha Freedom Party, have agreed to form a government of national unity.
title: South Africa’s ANC and opposition announce a unity government, in a big power shift

description: The U.S. is seeing a surge in avian flu. It's in chickens and cows and even sickened a few humans. Here's how other countries have dealt with the virus.
title: Thailand beat avian flu 20 years ago. What can we learn from their strategies?

description: Forecasters say the warming climate pattern El Niño is officially over. Its cooling counterpart, La Niña, could develop as soon as July — just in time to exacerbate an above-average hurricane season.
title: La Niña is likely to arrive this summer. Here's what that means for hurricane season

description: Hall of Famer Satchel Paige started his career pitching in the Negro leagues and later became a major league star. Author Larry Tye tells his story in Satchel. Originally broadcast in 2010.
title: 'Satchel' recalls the iconic pitcher who helped integrate Major League Baseball

description: The Supreme Court has struck down the federal ban on bump stocks Friday, declaring that the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives exceeded its authority when it banned the devices.
title: Supreme Court strikes down Trump-era federal ban on bump stocks

description: The hikers were visiting a popular Arizona tourist destination that features towering blue-green waterfalls on the Havasupai reservation deep in a gorge neighboring Grand Canyon National Park.
title: Dozens of hikers became ill during trips to waterfalls near the Grand Canyon

description: The Supreme Court unanimously rejected a challenge to the FDA's rules for the abortion pill mifepristone. NPR readers share the best advice their dads have given.
title: SCOTUS rejects abortion pill challenge; readers' dads give their best advice

description: In her new book, Dr. Casey Means argues that good metabolic function is key to preventing chronic disease. And she shares a prescription for boosting yours.
title: In 'Good Energy,' a doctor lays out how to measure and boost your metabolic health

description: A restaurant in St. Louis has been getting attention online for a unique rule: nobody under the age of 30 is allowed in. Is this an effective marketing strategy?
title: A St. Louis restaurant imposes age restrictions: no women under 30 or men under 35

description: In many places, kindergarteners are as likely to be chronically absent as high school seniors, but one school district in rural California is doing something about it.
title: Kindergartners are missing a lot of school. This district has a fix

description: NPR's Rob Schmitz speaks with FIFA agent Jeremy Pastel about the 2024 UEFA Men's European Football Championship, which kicks off Friday with Germany vs. France
title: Over the next month, 24 countries vie to be the men's European football champion

description: A judge is expected to tell Jones to sell off assets. But the families are likely to get only a tiny fraction of the nearly $1.5 billion in damages Jones owes for lies about the 2012 school shooting.
title: Alex Jones faces day of reckoning over what he owes Sandy Hook families

description: The billionaire philanthropist tells Morning Edition host Steve Inskeep his new TerraPower nuclear plant is safer than traditional builds. He’s putting his own money behind the project.
title: Bill Gates is going nuclear: How his latest project could power U.S. homes and AI

description: This week, Hunter Biden was convicted, G7 is happening and flash floods are, too. None of those things made the quiz, though, elbowed out by plant-based topics such as gardens, bananas and "meat."
title: Snubbed! Banned! Rejected! And that's just the first 3 questions of this week's quiz

description: There’s finally a consensus that ongoing digital attacks on the U.S. healthcare system constitute a crisis. The U.S. government is trying to work with partners to staunch the bleeding.
title: White House moves to secure rural health care systems from cyberattacks

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to  David Wessel, director of the Hutchins Center at the Brookings Institution, about former President Donald Trump's economic proposals.
title: As the election nears, an analysis of Donald Trump’s economic proposals

description: Oklahoma’s highest court rejected a reparations lawsuit brought by Viola Fletcher and Lessie Benningfield Randle, who lived through the racist attack over 100 years ago.
title: Oklahoma Supreme Court dismisses suit over reparations by survivors of Tulsa massacre

description: The National Weather Service cautioned that even smaller amounts of precipitation could impact saturated areas, causing flash floods on Friday before the region has a chance to recover.
title: Florida told to prepare for more flash flooding Friday following tropical storms
